data.title: 2013-09-10 Sochi Russia Stalin's Dacha, Ekaterina "Kato" Svanidze, Stalin's first wife (8)
data.meta_description:
Stalin would never have put these pictures in his office. This woman was his first wife whom he married when she was 19.
	
	Kato Svanidze married Joseph Stalin in St. David's church at Tiflis in 1906. They had a son, Yakov Dzhugashvili. She died of typhus (according to one report - others say mysterious circumstances and still other reports say suicide) in 1907. Much of her family (including her sister Mariko and brother Alexander) would later be executed during her husband's Great Terror.
	
	Stalin would later state that, other than his mother, she may have been the only person he truly loved.[citation needed] At her funeral, he said: "This creature softened my heart of stone. She died and with her died my last warm feelings for humanity." (paragraph from Wikipedia)
	
	He then married his second wife Nadezhda Alliluyeva and she soon could not get along with him. One day after a fight, she "committed suicide" according to official reports. Unofficial reports suggest he simply killed her. Her daughter ended up in the US and died recently. His granddaughter lives in the US under a different name. 
	
	Stalin had a hidden dacha in Sochi, Russia which is on the Black Sea in a district called the Kuban. It was painted green for camouflage. He was paranoid and crazy and considering what he did to others he had plenty to fear himself. It is now a hotel and you can rent his private bedroom which was on the first floor. It is a bit creepy being there especially if your family had been affected by him and those who supported him. He did not act alone when he killed over 20 million of our countrymen.
